meanings.definition: A person who lurks, especially online.
meanings.sent1: The lurker quietly observed the chat room without participating.
meanings.sent2: The online lurker was reading the forum posts without commenting.
meanings.sent3: The lurker chuckled at the funny memes shared in the group.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a digital lurker, hidden in the shadows of the internet.
meanings.sent5: The lurker's presence in the virtual world was mysterious and intriguing.

meanings.definition: One who lurks in a place, especially a spy or thief.
meanings.sent1: The lurker in the alley was watching for any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent2: The security guard caught the lurker trying to sneak into the building.
meanings.sent3: The lurker in the museum turned out to be an undercover detective.
meanings.sent4: The shadows seemed to dance around the lurking figure in the dark alley.
meanings.sent5: The lurker's eyes gleamed with mischief as they planned their next move.

meanings.sent1: She decided to lurk in the shadows until the coast was clear.
meanings.sent2: The cat would lurk behind the bushes waiting to pounce on its prey.
meanings.sent3: The spy lurked around the corner, trying to stay out of sight.
meanings.sent4: Dark clouds lurked on the horizon, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of danger lurked in the abandoned house as she cautiously stepped inside.
